item.title: Phys not healing poisoned bd?
item.dc:creator: newarkinvaders
item.description:
I’d go further to say it’s only a throw if the phys is not trying to win .
sticking with healing the revealed Prince rather than jumplng of to a poison bleed claim of a half confirmed bd that you are not sure about should always be the right for the player to choose.

Even not healing someone because you don’t personally believe their claim is your choice. it may not be tactically the best move . but players need to be able to make choices and make what others consider mistakes without it being considered throwing

item.title: Phys not healing poisoned bd?
item.dc:creator: Neclord
item.description:
Context matters in these situations.

I’ll give an example in a game I played recently as an Unseen:

A Prince was forced to reveal himself early because of a misunderstanding, we tried to attack him but he was being healed by a Phys.

I decided to announce the next day that an Assassin had poisoned me (I was Assassin) and that I desperately needed a heal. We attacked the Prince successfully the next night because the Phys tried healing me.

It cost me my life but because the Phys robotically healed any request for a heal it cost them the Prince in return.

This applies to neutrals being poisoned too. It’s only a throw if they are confirmed BD and they deliberately chose not to heal them.
